intro: Asterostoma virgata, commonly known as the velvetleaf, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae and is characterized by its broad, heart-shaped leaves and showy, pale yellow to purple flowers. The plant is often found in wetland habitats and can thrive in moist, fertile soils. It is known for its rapid growth and ability to spread through both seeds and rhizomes. Due to its invasive tendencies, it can pose a challenge in agricultural and natural ecosystems.
